de.tudarmstadt.ukp.clarin.webanno.brat.controller

Class ChainAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tudarmstadt.ukp.clarin.webanno.brat.controller.ChainAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TypeAdapter

    public class ChainAdapter
extends Object
implements TypeAdapter
    A class that is used to create Brat chain to CAS and vice-versa
    Author:
    Seid Muhie Yimam

      • render

        public void render(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJcas,
                   List<AnnotationFeature> aFeatures,
                   GetDocumentResponse aResponse,
                   BratAnnotatorModel aBratAnnotatorModel,
                   ColoringStrategy aColoringStrategy)
        Add annotations from the CAS, which is controlled by the window size, to the brat response GetDocumentResponse
        Specified by:
        render in interface TypeAdapter
        Parameters:
        aJcas - The JCAS object containing annotations
        aResponse - A brat response containing annotations in brat protocol
        aBratAnnotatorModel - Data model for brat annotations
        aColoringStrategy - the coloring strategy to render this layer (ignored)
        aFeatures - the features.

      • automate

        public void automate(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJcas,
                     AnnotationFeature aFeature,
                     List<String> labelValues)
              throws BratAnnotationException
        Description copied from interface: TypeAdapter
        Add new annotation to the CAS using the MIRA prediction. This is different from the add methods in the TypeAdapters in such a way that the begin and end offsets are always exact so that no need to re-compute
        Specified by:
        automate in interface TypeAdapter
        Parameters:
        aJcas - the JCas.
        aFeature - the feature.
        labelValues - the values.
        Throws:
        BratAnnotationException - if the annotations could not be created/updated.

      • setArc

        public void setArc(boolean aIsArc)

      • setLinkedListBehavior

        public void setLinkedListBehavior(boolean aBehaveLikeSet)
        Controls whether the chain behaves like a linked list or like a set. When operating as a set, chains are automatically threaded and no arrows and labels are displayed on arcs. When operating as a linked list, chains are not threaded and arrows and labels are displayed on arcs.
        Parameters:
        aBehaveLikeSet - whether to behave like a set.

      • isLinkedListBehavior

        public boolean isLinkedListBehavior()
